content.description: A long draw (e.g. alpine draw) on the 4th bolt may help with any rope drag.
content.location: Starts up and right of the end of the approach trail, in an alcove. The first bolt is about 25' up, after an easy scramble.

content.description: I wouldn't recommend this route for practicing placing gear.  I would stick to The Other White Meat if your just starting out placing gear. Despite the slightly harder rating its easier to place gear.  This is one is worth doing if you've done any of the others as a top rope if your with a newer group.
content.protection: Small gear or top rope to the common anchor.
content.location: Between conjunction and junction in the school room area.

content.description: Corner crack that can be dirty in spots if no one has been on it in a while.  Great crack to practice your trad skills better so than the running scared crack.
content.protection: medium to large gear, In Todd Goss's book he marks that there is anchors at the top in the book but there really isn't.  You can build an anchor and extend off of a tree.
content.location: In the middle of the school room area, walk off and go down to the right.

content.description: When I first climbed here several years ago I found this climb to be harder than other 5.7's i've done but I think it was because of  rapidly coming up to higher altitude and not being used to it.  Now I would agree with the 5.7 rating.  Probably the better of the climbs on this wall.
content.protection: Four bolts to the common 2 bolt anchor
content.location: The farthest to the right on the school room wall.

content.description: An easy scramble gets you to the first bolt. Climb the tan face immediately left of the faint black streak.
content.location: Up and slightly left of the end of the approach trail; about 20 feet behind the aspen tree.

content.description: After a short scramble on good rock climb the short overhang to gain the tan face. Continue on good edges past a few horizontal breaks.
content.location: Start behind a boulder in the alcove directly above the end of the approach trail. The first bolt is about 25 feet up.

content.description: Another fun moderate climb on this moderate wall.  If you don't lead this one its easy to set up a TR for this one.  Easy edging to the common anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a common two bolt anchor for running scared and Junction.
content.location: Between The other white meat and Running Scared in the school room area.

content.description: After an easy scramble, climb the broken-looking face left of the shallow corner. Much better than it looks.
content.location: Start behind a boulder in the alcove directly above the end of the approach trail. The first bolt is about 25 feet up and left.

content.description: After an easy scramble, climb the face via edges and pockets.
content.location: Straight up the ramp above the end of the approach trail.
